Detailed Description

Utility functions for memory manipulation.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum MemCmp_Result_t

Result of memory comparison, where a success requires many bits to be set (more secure)

Enumerator
MEMCMP_SUCCESS 

Success

MEMCMP_FAIL 

Failure

Function Documentation

void* memcpy32 ( void *  dst,
const void *  src,
uint32_t  size 
)

Copy memory from source in memory to destination.

Description: Copies size bytes from src memory area to dst memory area. NOTE: Addresses and size must be 32-bit aligned.

Parameters
dstPointer to destination memory area
srcPointer to source memory area
sizeSize of data in bytes
Returns
Void pointer to the destination memory
void* memset32 ( void *  ptr,
int  value,
size_t  size 
)

Fills a block of memory with a constant value.

Description: Sets size bytes of memory starting at ptr with value value NOTE: Address and size must be 32-bit aligned.

Parameters
ptrPointer to memory
valueValue to set
sizeSize of memory in bytes
Returns
Void pointer to the memory
void ReverseBytes32 ( void *  ptr,
uint32_t  size 
)

Reverses bytes in memory.

Description: Reverses in-place the size bytes in ptr memory area, so that the last byte in the buffer becomes the first byte. This is typically used to deal with endianness. NOTE: Address and size must be 32-bit aligned.

Parameters
ptrPointer to memory
sizeSize of memory in bytes
Returns
void
void ReverseMemCpy32 ( void *  dst,
const void *  src,
uint32_t  size 
)

Copy memory from source to destination, reversing bytes.

Description: Copies size bytes from src memory area to dst memory area, reversing the bytes in the process so that the last byte in dst is the first byte in src. This is typically used to deal with endianness. Note that the buffers CANNOT overlap. NOTE: Addresses and size must be 32-bit aligned.

Parameters
dstPointer to destination memory area
srcPointer to source memory area
sizeSize of data in bytes
Returns
void
MemCmp_Result_t SecureMemCmp32 ( const void *  ptr1,
const void *  ptr2,
size_t  n 
)

Compares memory in a secure manner.

Description: Compares first n bytes of memory areas ptr1 and ptr2. The comparison is done in secure way, where the execution time will always be the same (timing invariant), and a successful return value consists of more than a single bit being set. NOTE: Addresses and size must be 32-bit aligned.

Parameters
ptr1Pointer to memory area 1
ptr2Pointer to memory area 2
nSize in bytes of memory to compare
Returns
MemCmp_Result_t indicating the result of the comparison.
